conclusion: The task is to determine the volume of an irregularly shaped solid using the device shown in the figure.
The device consists of a U-tube connected to a container labeled C, a liquid reservoir labeled D, and a valve labeled K. The U-tube has markings m and n.
The initial volume of the gas in the U-tube is measured as \( V_C \), and it is at a pressure \( P_0 \).
The U-tube is connected to the liquid, which is at a pressure \( P \).
The final volume of the gas in the U-tube is measured as \( V_B \), and it is now at a pressure \( P \).
Boyle's law states that the volume of a gas is inversely proportional to its pressure, expressed as \( \frac{V_C}{P_0} = \frac{V_B}{P} \).
Rearranging the equation \( \frac{V_C}{P_0} = \frac{V_B}{P} \), the volume of the solid is calculated as \( V_B = \frac{P_0 \cdot V_C}{P} \).
The volume of the measured solid is determined to be \( V_B = \frac{P_0 \cdot V_C}{P} \).
